examples: Could you spell your name again, please?
If he does it again I'll have to tell him.
Throw it away and start again.

body_content.explanation: back to the original place or condition:
examples: We went to Edinburgh and back again all in one day.
Get some rest and you'll soon be well again.

body_content.explanation: If something happens once again, it has already happened several times before:
examples: You are reminded once again of the author's love of the sea.

body_content.explanation: said after an unpleasant experience to show that you do not intend to do it again:
examples: He drove me back home last night. Never again!

body_content.explanation: If something happens yet again, it has already happened many times before:
examples: I'm afraid it's been delayed yet again.
I've told you again and again not to do that.

body_content.explanation: If you do something all over again, you start again from the beginning:
examples: It's already taken me two hours - I don't want to have to do it all over again.

body_content.explanation: in addition to the amount we know about or have mentioned already:
examples: They are paid half as much again as we are.
